metadata.title: CVE-2023-52859 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: perf:hisi: Fix use-after-free when register pmu fails When we fail to registerthe uncore pmu, the pmu context may not been allocated. The error handingwill call cpuhp_state_remove_instance() to call uncore pmu offlinecallback, which migrate the pmu context. Since that's liable to lead tosome kind of use-after-free. Use cpuhp_state_remove_instance_nocalls()instead of cpuhp_state_remove_instance() so that the notifiers don'texecute after the PMU device has been failed to register.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
